actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-794, by Mr. Derrick.

Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to H. Con. Res. 310 with 2 hours 0 of general debate. The conference report shall be considered as having been read when called up for consideration. Following disposition of the conference report, no motion with respect to disposition of H. Con. Res. 310 shall be in order except pursuant to a subsequent order of the House. The allocations of spending and credit responsibility to the committees of the House shall be considered to be the allocations required to be printed in the joint statement of managers pursuant to sec. 302(a) of the Budget Act. Rule XLIX shall not apply with respect to conference report adoption.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 173.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by voice vote.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 339 - 94 (Roll no. 420).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for consideration of the conference report on the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 310) setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for the fiscal years 1991, 1992, 1993, 1994, and 1995.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of the conference report on H. Con. Res. 310 (congressional budget).

titles.title: Providing for consideration of the conference report on the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 310) setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for the fiscal years 1991, 1992, 1993, 1994, and 1995.
